data.title: A "center" option for interactive shapes
data.body:
Drawing lines (Line2D), polygons (Polygon2D) and curves (Path2D) on the editor can lead to the figure being displaced from the node center and sometimes is hard to re-position them.

A (scene editor) way to center the figure to the origin of the node could be really useful.

ps: This "center" (or arbitrary "displace") option could be part of Vector arrays too to make it more generic but I don't know if there are plans to give extra functions to these kind of arrays.

data.title: adding reflection probe crashes editor
data.body:

Linux 64 bit (Arch)
Godot built from master branch 43a84429ff2fb0ba120f38797dcf313370b3bd18
Graphics card:  GeForce GT 630M using primusrun (Bumblebee) and Intel Corporation 3rd Gen integrated GPU
**Issue description:**
When I try to add reflection probe to the scene tree editor crashes

**Steps to reproduce:**
create reflection probe node using editor.

**Output of `godot -d`**
```
 ERROR: move_child: Invalid new child position: 2                                              5.5s  pią, 16 cze 2017, 17:31:40

```

There is no response from the game controller.
However I still get reports of the strange InputEventKey I reported in #9214 , and gamepad connection changes are also reported, just no buttons, axis, etc

data.title: strange bug: Godot sets all the variables of an array to the value that it should only be appending
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 - 2.1.2-stable


**Issue description:**
When appending an item to an array during a while loop, Godot also sets all of the remaining 
items in that array to the value that it is appending


**Steps to reproduce:**
Here is a minimal script to replicate it:
```
func _ready():
	var l1frames = ["a","b","c"]
	var l2frames = ["a","b" ]
	var l3frames = ["a","b","c"]
	var layers = [l1frames,l2frames,l3frames]
	createVariationMixFrameSequence(layers)

func createVariationMixFrameSequence(layers):  #return array of combinations [[1,1,1],[1,1,2], ..etc]
	var mixEnd = [] #maximum frame number- use that to decide when to move on to the next 
	var newMixResult = []

	for layer in layers:
		mixEnd.append(layer.size()-1)
		newMixResult.append(0)

	var maxItElements = mixEnd.size()-1  
	print("MixEnd:",mixEnd ," MixStart:",newMixResult," elements:",maxItElements)  
 
	var BANK = [] ## put all resulting mix arrays in here

	var curItElement = maxItElements  

	while curItElement > -1: 
		print("--------iterating on:",curItElement," (",mixEnd[curItElement]+1,")--------")
		while newMixResult[curItElement] < mixEnd[curItElement]:
			newMixResult[curItElement] += 1 
			print(">>>>> New Mix rsult:",newMixResult," <<<<<")

			BANK.append(newMixResult) # <<-- This is where the error happens!
			print("Bank:",BANK) # <<-- This is where the error happens!

		curItElement -= 1 
```

Here is the output of the last print : 

```
--------iterating on:2 (3)--------
>>>>>New Mix rsult:[0, 0, 1]<<<<<
Bank:[[0, 0, 1]]
>>>>>New Mix rsult:[0, 0, 2]<<<<<
Bank:[[0, 0, 2], [0, 0, 2]]
--------iterating on:1 (2)--------
>>>>>New Mix rsult:[0, 1, 2]<<<<<
Bank:[[0, 1, 2], [0, 1, 2], [0, 1, 2]]
```
as you can see , the BANK array in the last print - instead of appending the newMixResult, it has also changed all of the other variables in the array to the new mixResult, overwriting them.

Any idea why it's doing that? Am I missing something here? If so, how the hell do I get this to work as intended?

data.title: Add sensible hints to properties for primitive meshes
data.body:
This is only the first change in relation to #9210 

This introduces hopefully sensible range hints so the sliders have a proper range.

Currently there is still an issue with the sliders because changing the value updates the mesh right away. Not sure yet how that should be fixed.

data.title: [GDNative] corrected typo for Mac library ext.
data.body:
Seems like the extension is .dylib and not .dynlib.
This should make it easier to select files from the editor.


cc @BastiaanOlij is this correct?

data.title: Issues with new MeshInstance primitives
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master
Intel HD4000

**Issue description:**
I just tested the new MeshInstance primitives and noticed 2 issues:

1. The objects can't be selected in the editor viewport but only from the inspector

2. more severe: trying using the sliders to set properties completely freezes godot for me and slows down my computer massively. probably because moving them even a little bit quickly leads to setting insanely high values? there should maybe be a limit of sane values for certain properties. 


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. add a MeshInstance node and fill Mesh slot with a NewCubeMesh
2. try to edit the primitive's Subdivide properties using a slider (beware: this made my desktop environment freeze completely in some instances)


[edit]
While Godot is frozen after using the slider, it quickly eats up all my system memory and my cpu as at constant 100% (thus the massive slowdown)

data.title: Lost controller input after it went to sleep
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** XBox UWP (built with Godot 2.2)

**Issue description:**
After a few minutes of inactivity the xbox controller shutsdown to save power (I guess). When turning it back on, the game won't receive input from the controller anymore.

data.title: Increase the default perspective camera FOV
data.body:
This makes the editor and game views feel less cramped by default, as you can see more things on your screen thanks to the higher field of view. This does not affect existing projects, but will affect newly-created editor settings and Camera nodes.

**Old default editor FOV (45), non-distraction-free mode:**
![fov_45_no_df](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27222466-a2612474-528c-11e7-8b68-3ba1dabea99f.jpg)

**Old default editor FOV (45), distraction-free mode:**
![fov_45_df](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27222463-a25f6846-528c-11e7-8c0e-3407292c5162.jpg)

**New default editor FOV (55), non-distraction-free mode:**
![fov_55_no_df](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27222464-a260ea9a-528c-11e7-9bdb-f4cca4cf545d.jpg)

**New default editor FOV (55), distraction-free mode:**
![fov_55_df](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/27222465-a261109c-528c-11e7-84bb-b3e651080080.jpg)

This pull request also increases the default FOV of perspective cameras to 65 (from 60).

Feel free to discuss and test by yourself; freelooking around in the editor is a good way to see if it looks right or not.

data.title: New directories aren't read/scanned without restarting editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0, master branch, has been an issue for two months at least, including on current revision (7a8a789)
Arch Linux (x11), Windows 10

**Issue description:**
New directories (e.g. created when saving a new scene) are not updated/read correctly in the FileSystem panel, until the editor is restarted.

The new directory appears in the directory tree (top half of FileSystem) but when selected, the file contents (lower panel) appear as if the root (res://) is selected. Likewise, trying to mark the new dir as a favourite adds the root as a favourite.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new folder and save a resource in it with the normal file chooser dialog.
Select the new folder in the FileSystem panel

data.title: Add Vector.set_length(length) and (optionally) Vector.add_length(length)
data.body:
`Vector.set_length(float lenght)` would be just syntactic sugar for doing `myvector = myvector.normalized() * length`
`Vector.add_length(float increment)` would be just syntactic sugar for doing `myvector = myvector.normalized() * (myvector.length() + increment)`

It's not a huge annoyance but coming from Phaser I miss not having an equivalent to Phaser.Point.setMagnitude()

data.title: Should editor always open scripts with external editor?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1 and Godot 3.0 for all platform.

**Issue description:**

I usually use [VSCode](https://code.visualstudio.com) as an external editor to view and write scripts. Every time when I click on the script file in godot editor it works really fine to open the script with VSCode.

But when some thing got wrong with my scripts or a break point reached, the godot editor still open the scripts with external code editor to stop me continue debug the script. This force me to switch godot editor window back from the external code editor. Then I press F10 to continue debug and I will lost the debugger window again. This debug experience is so bad.

Do we really want the scripts opened with external code editor without manaully open it?

I hope there is an option in editor setting to manage this behavior.

data.title: Ability to set import settings as default for a resource type
data.body:
Currently there's no way to set default import settings for each type of resource. It would be interesting to, e.g. import all textures without filter by default in a 2D pixel art game.

Talking to @reduz on IRC, he suggested a "Set as default" button for this.

data.title: Hang Attempting to import stl as mesh
data.body:
Windows 7 64bit. Godot Version : 2.1.3


User Case: 
Exporting a file from blender and importing a file into godot.

Steps:
1. Launch Godot and open a project.
2. Click "Import" , "Mesh".
3. Open file browser for "Source Mesh(es)"
4. Select all file types.
5. Select .stl file. 
6. Click "Open".
7. Open Select Path browser.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21026917/27203400-a0f56c4a-521d-11e7-95cb-15aa496be9cb.png)
7.note: I did not seem to be able to select a sensible output path, screen shot attached.
8. Click "Import".

The program will stop responding at this point.
I required task manager to kill.

What I would expect:
- Block the selection of the .stl file.

data.title: Rename "sugar" resource extensions to avoid conflicts with established thirdparty extensions
data.body:
Prompted by the fact that OBJ's `.mtl` material extension is the same as Godot's `.mtl` (and we might want to add support for OBJ's `.mtl` in the future), we propose to rename those "sugar" resource extensions (they're synonyms for the actual `.res` binary format) to avoid conflicts.

The idea is to use full names instead of 3-letter short names, so "mtl" becomes "material" and so on.

Proposal (might have missed some extensions, if so comment):

| Old | New |
| --- | --- |
| anm | animation |
| asogg | oggstream(?) |
| atex | atlastexture | 
| cbm | cubemap |
| cvtex | curvetexture |
| fnt | font |
| gt | meshlib |
| ltex | largetexture |
| mmsh | multimesh |
| msh | mesh |
| mtl | material |
| pbm | pbm (standard) |
| res | res (flagship extension) |
| room | room (no change needed) |
| sbx | stylebox |
| scn | scn (flagship extension) |
| sgp | shadergraph |
| shd | shader |
| shp | shape |
| smp | sample |
| tex | texture |
| thm | theme |
| wrd | world |
| xl | translation |

data.title: Ability to get a list of signals that are targeting given object
data.body:
Object has new method "get_incoming_connections" that's returning an array of dictionaries with informations about signals that are connected to this object.
Inside each dictionary there are 3 fields:
- "source" is a reference to signal emitter
- "signal_name" is name of signal that's connected
- "method_name" is a name of method to which signal is connected

data.title: Globals.save() fails with error 12
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
On Android, probably also on other platforms when res:// is pointing to a read/only directory
Godot 2.1.3 stable

The error might not occur if Android is rooted.

**Issue description:**
I want to change a value in the engine.cfg from GDScript.
"Globals" allows this, but on save it files with error 12 (ERR_FILE_CANT_OPEN). This is because it tries to write the config to its initial position in res:// which is read-only on many platforms.

Saving to another location is possible via Globals.save_customs() but the game/app won't read it on startup. So that is useless AFAIK.

I've seen in the source that godot also tries to read/merge a override.cfg on startup, but also... only from res:// or the current directory. A solution for this problem would be when godot searches for an override.cfg (or whatever) in user:// because that is the directory where files are allowed to be written (usually).

**Steps to reproduce:**
var res= Globals.save()
print("Globals save, result: "+String(res))

data.title: stencil shadow support
data.body:
Would love to see stencil shadow support in godot 3.0. 
I know its not a common technique these days, but its great for getting crisp shadows. 
I would love to use them in the project Im working on currently.
Also the stencil voumes only need to be generated at load time for static objects.
